New Records: KL Rahul has come in and sorted India's middle-order weakness
KL Rahul has shown outstanding transformation from being an opener to a middle-order batter
Virat Kohli has scored 64 fifty-plus scores in 148 innings in an ODI chase
India have won the match by 6 wickets with 52 balls remaining
Key Match Events: KL Rahul scored 97* to lead India to victory
Virat Kohli scored 85 before being dismissed by Josh Hazlewood
Ravindra Jadeja picked up three wickets in two overs to turn the game around for India
Jasprit Bumrah bowled a tight spell to restrict Australia's scoring
Australia's spinners struggled to grip the ball due to dew and humidity
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted India as the favorites given their home advantage
Australia's spinners need to sit on a good length spot and keep the stumps in play
India's middle-order has been a weakness in ICC tournaments lately
KL Rahul has been in good form and has the potential to make a big impact
Post-Match Reflections: KL Rahul expressed pride in his team's performance and said that they were able to overcome their middle-order weakness
Virat Kohli said that the team's win was a great start to the World Cup
Ravindra Jadeja praised his teammates for their performance and said that they were able to execute their plans well
Miscellaneous Highlights: The dew in Chennai played a significant role in the match, affecting the ball's grip and movement
Australia's batters struggled to score on a slow pitch, with many dot balls being conceded
India's spinners were able to exploit the conditions to pick up wickets
The match was played in front of a packed crowd at the MA Chidambaram Stadium
